INTR 160.courseDesc: An introductory course that explores the use of proprietary computer applications for communications and the preparation of visual materials in Interior Design. The course introduces and reinforces classic design principles for expert visual communication of ideas through digital techniques from an Interior Design perspective.
INTR 160.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 200.fullName: History of Modern Architecture and Interiors
INTR 200.courseDesc: Covers development of modern architecture and interiors in the 19th and 20th centuries. Develops a vocabulary for discussing architecture; an understanding of how various factors affect design; and a familiarity with names, movements, and buildings that are part of historical development.
INTR 200.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 211.courseDesc: This course is a comprehensive introduction to textiles and their use in the interior design profession.
INTR 211.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 220.courseDesc: This course explores design communication skills through hand drawing and model building exercises. Orthographic drawing skills are developed through investigation of plan, section, elevation and three dimensional drawings.
INTR 220.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 225.courseDesc: This course introduces design students to the relationship between people and the build environment. Understanding how people perceive, interact with, and are affected by their surroundings through readings and design exercieses make evident the significance of the psychological, pyshicological, social and cultural concepts of environmental behavior as an integral part of the designed environment.
INTR 225.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 231.courseDesc: Investigates structure as an organizing principle in design by man and nature. Explores the basic objective and subjective relationships between form and function. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 231.prereqs: VSST 103 [Min Grade C-] or VSST 106 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 241.courseDesc: An intensive introduction to two and three dimensional drawing and visualization through the computer. This course explores orthographic and perspective drawing conventions and techniques from a digital perspective.
INTR 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 241.prereqs: INTR 232 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 322 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 245.courseDesc: An intensive introduction to advanced modeling and rendering software. Students will explore lighting, materiality, advanced form and spatial experience through realistic three-dimensional digital models.
INTR 245.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 250.courseDesc: Introduces basic construction materials and how they may be used successfully by the interior designer. Includes sample materials, visual aids, and guest speakers.
INTR 250.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 300.courseDesc: Visual Culture: Interiors addresses the interior environment by studying the role history, economics, culture, materials and technological developments, impact decisions made by designers on interior spaces. While comparing historical context with specific knowledge, this course will enable the student to be a more articulate designer by a comprehensive examination of the interiors.
INTR 300.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 305.courseDesc: An overview of furniture in relationship to interiors, and its influences reaching from the roots of antiquity to the impact of technology in today's products. It is the study of artifacts from various time periods and cultures in relation to social and political developments, life and work styles, visual arts, and economic influences.
INTR 305.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 310.courseDesc: Course examines the meaning and implications of sustainable design to develop an informed interpretation and working assessment of this movement. Concepts and methodologies are explored through assigned readings, class discussion, feild trips and team research.
INTR 310.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 322.courseDesc: Foundation spatial course: Involves conscious recognition of the manipulation of space or spaces within a given volume and with a small-scale environmental orientation. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 322.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 322.prereqs: VSST 103 [Min Grade C-] or VSST 106 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 323.courseDesc: Primary spatial course. Involves conscious recognition of the manipulation of space or spaces within a given volume and small-scale environmental orientation. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 323.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 323.prereqs: INTR 232 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 322 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 331.courseDesc: Provides experience with extensive real space. Emphasizes recognizing its aesthetic quality and maximizing its potential to meet the requirements of the inhabitants, by stylistic quality and elaboration in the selection and application of furniture finishes and accessories. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 331.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 331.prereqs: INTR 233 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 323 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 340.courseDesc: Covers research, diagramming, site considerations, and program requirements for a specific user group; designing for complex spatial requirements with integration of interior components and furniture. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 340.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 341.courseDesc: An advanced course in visualization for Interior Design. Hybrid representation strategies and specialized topics in digital and hand rendering will be covered.
INTR 341.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 342.courseDesc: This course covers the design of commercial hospitality interiors. The studio project addresses program research and diagramming, site specificity, and designing for complex requirements with an awareness of vertical circulation, light, view, and enclosure. This course requires students to develop the ceiling plane and to create a visual identity for the design of restaurant interiors. This studio includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 342.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 350.courseDesc: Covers basic considerations of interior construction and detailing and their application.
INTR 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 350.prereqs: INTR 250 [Min Grade D] and (INTR 233 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 323 [Min Grade C-])

INTR 351.courseDesc: This course analyzes human needs and the perceptual responses of both general and special populations. It introduces the lighting design theory and principles and explores methods of creating mood and atmosphere with light. It develops vocabulary, documentation methods and understanding of energy conservation, lighting standards, and safety.
INTR 351.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 410.courseDesc: This cumulative course is the advanced students' opportunity to participate in a collaborative, interdisciplinary team in which the students will be applying sustainable technical and conceptual education in the context of 3rd party competitions, internally defined design challenges or applied research.
INTR 410.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 430.courseDesc: Covers design of institutional-commercial interiors, including space planning, selection of materials and furnishings toward a synthesized environment, and development of specifications. Includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 430.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 430.prereqs: INTR 342 [Min Grade C-] or INTR 442 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 440.courseDesc: This studio addresses program and design requirements for a specific demographic community. It will prepare students to tackle the complex design problems that face the growing healthcare industry. The course focuses on an interdisciplinary approach to complex problems in the interior environment for the practice areas of health, healing, and well-being. Precedent studies, programming briefs, literature reviews, and collaborative teamwork are used to create evidence-based design solutions that incorporate creativity, human factors data, user-centered design approach, life-safety codes, and building codes. This studio includes professionally juried presentations.
INTR 440.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 441.courseDesc: Covers design of environmental elements, simultaneous concerns with craftsmanship and the application of materials to ideas, and development of prototypes. A lab fee is required for this course.
INTR 441.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 441.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 13 credits

INTR 445.courseDesc: Provides an understanding of the basic procedures and techniques for the development of construction drawings and furniture documentation. Requires students to use case studies to produce a set of drawings representative of current interior design industry standards.
INTR 445.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 445.prereqs: INTR 245 [Min Grade D] and INTR 430 [Min Grade C-]

INTR 450.courseDesc: Surveys contemporary business methods, practices, and procedures in the operation of a design firm, including legal and ethical implications. Examines these practices through case studies and lectures by design professionals.
INTR 450.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 451.courseDesc: Introduces building systems, mechanical, electrical, ceiling and furniture systems, and their effect on the interior environment. Includes visual aids and guest speakers.
INTR 451.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 470.courseDesc: Competition opportunities from regional to international from professional to philanthropic allow for investigations of diverse contemporary issues surrounding the built environment. Students work under direction of a faculty member(s) to discuss, explore and develop solutions for entry into noteworthy competitions.
INTR 470.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR 470.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 6 credits

INTR 491.courseDesc: Part one of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
INTR 491.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 492.courseDesc: Part two of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
INTR 492.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR 493.courseDesc: Part three of the 3-term senior project where students develop a capstone independent design project from concept, research and programming to complete design development.
INTR 493.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

INTR I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
INTR I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
INTR I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
INTR I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
INTR I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
INTR T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
INTR T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

INTR T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
INTR T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
